intro: Amphitecna breedlovei, commonly known as the Texas mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its silver-green foliage and clusters of white to lavender flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Amphitecna breedlovei is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
